title: snout
body:
The protruding portion of an animal's face, consisting of its [[animal_nose|nose]], mouth, and jaw. In many animals, the equivalent structure is called a muzzle, rostrum, or proboscis.

Snouts are found on many mammals in a variety of shapes. Some animals, including ursines and great cats, have box-like snouts, while others, like shrews, have pointed snouts. Pig snouts are flat and cylindrical.

[[furry|Anthropomorphic]] characters often show their snouts on a profile view, similarly to how human anime characters only show the contour of their noses on a profile view.

h4. See also
* [[animal nose]] - used when a dot-like nose is shown on the character

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Snout":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snout

title: sharpe_(series)
body:
Sharpe was a British TV movie series based on the novels of the same name by Bernard Cornwell. It ran from 5 May 1993 
to 9 November 2008 with a total of 16 episodes.

Set during the Napoleonic Wars, the series follows Englishman Richard Sharpe (played by Sean Bean), a sergeant in the 95th Rifles. After the saving the life of General Sir Arthur Wellesley, the future Duke of Wellington, from French Cavalrymen, Sharpe is promoted lieutenant and ordered by Sir Wellington to led a small special task force within the 95th Rifles.

Along with his second in command, Irishman Patrick Harper, Sharpe and his chosen men fight against the French throughout Europe while performing special missions for Wellington. Along the way, Sharpe also has to deal with enemies within the British Army, mostly jealous officers and arrogant nobles who despise Sharpe due to his lower background and jealously over Sharpe being a better soldier and leader than them.

She is a compulsive gambler but has no luck. Her liegewoman is [[Shizune (Naruto)|]]. Although she is already 50 years old, she is able to look younger as long she has enough energy.

Her animal motif is a [[slug]], as seen in when she summons [[Katsuyu (naruto)|]].

title: organ_(instrument)
body:
A class of keyboard instrument characterized by various sounds of unlimited sustain. The earliest common organs were [[pipe organ]]s built for churches. Their sound came from pressurized air moving through specially formed metal pipes. Pipe organs are still in use in many Western churches and concert halls worldwide.

The [[pump organ]] (see post #657165) is a small pipe organ conceived for home use. The air in this instrument is generated by foot-pedal bellows, which one pumps with alternating feet.

There are also [[electric organ]]s (such as found at post #519301) whose sounds are generated through circuits. The Hammond B3 is arguably the most famous of this type, widely used in jazz, blues and rock music.

A prominent feature of most types of organs is the existence of at least two manuals (keyboard sets; with a light, spring-weighted action unlike that of a piano), a pedalboard, and a number of "stops" or switches which activate different sets of pipes for varied color.

*Not to be confused with biological [[organs]].*

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

body:

h4. Product Lines
* [b]Kuro Kara Kuri[/b] - Premium non-transforming figures of robots, primarily Transformers characters.
* [b]Hito Kara Kuri[/b] - Premium figures of human characters.
* [b]Furai Model[/b] - Non-transforming [[model kit|plastic model kits]] based on Transformers characters.
* [b]Furai Action[/b] - Pre-built non-transforming action figures of Transformers characters, similar quality to the Furai Model kits.

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(ova)
body:
[b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] (ソニック★ザ★ヘッジホッグ, [i]Sonikku za Hejjihoggu[/i]) or [b]Sonic the Hedgehog: The Movie[/b], is a two-episode OVA based on the [[Sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] franchise. Produced by Pierrot, directed by Kazunori Ikegami and written by Masashi Kubota, the OVA was originally released in Japan in 1996, with its two thirty-minute episodes over two separate VHS tapes. 

The two episodes were titled "[b]Welcome to Eggmanland[/b]" (エッグマンランドへむかえ, [i]Eggumanrando e Mukae[/i]) and "[b]Sonic vs. Metal Sonic!![/b]" (ソニックＶＳメタル・ソニック！！, [i]Sonikku tai Metaru Sonikku!![/i]).

The anime features [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]], [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]], [[Knuckles the Echidna|Knuckles]], [[Dr. Eggman]] (Dr. Robotnik in the English release), [[Metal Sonic]] and a few supporting characters created exclusively for the OVA. It also featured an ending theme "Look-a-like", with music score composed by Mitsuhiro Tada, who also did the arrangement for "Look-a-like".

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sonic the Hedgehog (OVA)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(OVA)]
* "Anime News Network: Sonic the Hedgehog":[https://myanimelist.net/anime/2263/Sonic%E2%98%85the%E2%98%85Hedgehog]

title: sonic_rivals
body:
Sonic Rivals is a 2006 side-scrolling platform game in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series developed by Backbone Entertainment for the [[PlayStation Portable]]. It is notable for introducing [[Silver the Hedgehog]]'s current main series incarnation, as opposed to the Silver featured in the alternate timeline bad future seen in [[Sonic the Hedgehog (2006)]].

This game is also noteworthy as being one of the few Sonic games that has never seen a release in Japan, along with it's sequel, Sonic Rivals 2.

title: gunflame
body:
A ground tracking projectile, [[Sol Badguy]] slams his [[Fireseal]] into the ground and shouts "[i]“GUN FLAME!”[/i]":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_5MAxT-IOjQ, unleashing an explosive flame.

The first iteration in Guilty Gear is a ground hugging fireball that travels across the stage.

This was later changed into the now iconic four flame pillars erupting from the ground but limited range in the later installments.
It also has a feint version where Sol mimics the motion but doesn't unleash it.
While in Dragon Install, it becomes a big long range (but still limited) fire projectile.

title: subarashii_pose
body:
Stock mad scientist pose in Japanese works of fiction. Both palms open and turned skyward, with arms spread open and raised slightly in a confident, 'welcoming' gesture. Arms may sometimes be  raised higher above the head. Legs usually remain standing, spread apart slightly (though some may have them close together as if standing at attention).

Often accompanied with the stock exclamation of "SUBARASHII", hence the name. This is usually translated into English as "magnificent" [tn](c.f. [[Bondrewd]])[/tn], "majestic" [tn](c.f. [[micolash_host_of_the_nightmare|Micolash]])[/tn], "marvelous"  [tn](also [[Bondrewd]])[/tn], "wonderful", "magnifique", etc.

Mad scientists in Western works may also sometimes strike a similar pose, but this is far less common, as they tend to prefer other more intimidating poses.

[expand=The Western equivalent, do not tag]The standard Western cliched equivalent generally involves one arm raised and clenched in a claw-like pose, with the other raised higher and 'pointed' towards the general direction of the viewer or another character. This second arm can be either 'open' or clenched closed, and is usually also holding another object: generally a test tube, flask, ray gun, wrench, or some other 'sciencey' implement.[/expand]

h4. Notable examples
* [[Bondrewd]] ([[Made in Abyss]])
** That's like his shtick. 
* [[Micolash Host of the Nightmare|Micolash, Host of the Nightmare]] ([[Bloodborne]])
** Also his after he went cuckoo with a literal birdcage on his head.

h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag subarashii_pose when a character (or figurine, possibly) strikes the pose described above.
* Some [[outstretched arms]] poses may look superficially similar, though generally to count the overall impression has to scream "mad scientist".
** The best yardstick would probably be "Am I reminded of [[Bondrewd]]?" and "Does this make me want to scream "SUBARASHII?"
** If yes, then it is almost certainly the subarashii_pose.

title: oculus_(genshin_impact)
body:
An object found in [[Genshin Impact]].

A substance containing immense elemental energy. In-game, players restore statues by offering oculi to them.

The general design has a center core orbited by two exterior decorations. The specific colors and design of the oculus varies by its element and region (e.g. turquoise colors and feather shapes for Anemo oculi).

title: seelie_(genshin_impact)
body:
Creatures found in [[Genshin Impact]].

Small, flying, wisplike creatures that reside in Teyvat. Seelies used to act as guides for mankind, now merely rewarding those who guide the Seelies back to their courts. Infant Seelies do not seek courts, and instead accompany travelers to see the world.

Their bodies are a solid color, with a singular white orb in a round head. Adult Seelie have a flowing body behind this head and two long whiskers; infant Seelie solely consist of the head, and potentially two small ears.

title: misaka_imouto_9982
body:
One of the many "Sisters" - clones of [[Misaka Mikoto]]. 9982, as her name implies, was the 9982nd of 20,000. She was also the first one with which the Railgun had contact, and received a Gekota pin as a "present" from her original, a feature that usually distinguishes her from the other identical clones.

[spoiler]As indicated by her number, this Sister was quite brutally murdered by [[Accelerator (toaru majutsu no index)|]] during the Level 6 Shift Project, right in front of a powerless Mikoto's eyes.[/spoiler]

title: hercules_beetle
body:
A species of [[rhinoceros beetle]], and the longest species of beetle in the world. Male hercules beetles have a gigantic horn on their prothorax, as well as immense strength for their size.

Males have black bodies, outside their elytra (wing cases), which are shades of olive-green with black spots and are divided by a black suture. Females lack the species' characteristic horns, and are mostly black outside a quarter of the elytra, which may have the same color pattern as males.

title: jiraiya_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto]] otherwise known by his nickname [b]Pervy Sage[/b] (エロ仙人, [i]ero sen'nin[/i]).

He is one of the Legendary Sannin along with [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] and [[Orochimaru (naruto)|]], all of whom trained under [[Sarutobi Hiruzen]] (The Third Hokage). He is the mentor of [[Namikaze Minato]] (The Fourth Hokage), and later [[Uzumaki Naruto]].

His animal motif is a [[frog]], mostly shown by summoning [[Gamabunta (Naruto)|Gamabunta]].

title: yakushi_kabuto
body:
[[Naruto]] villain.

He first appeared as a spy of the Hidden Leaf Village only to betray the Villagers and complete his true purpose of serving is actual lord [[Orochimaru (naruto)|]] and move to the Hidden Sound Village.

He is a Medical Ninja, and thus able to heal himself since he is trained in Medical Ninjutsu.

title: mitarashi_anko
body: A kunoichi from the [[Naruto]] franchise. She is a special jonin and proctor of the Chuunin exams. The legendary sannin [[Orochimaru (naruto)|]] was her sensei before he defected from Konoha, and Anko hates him to the present, but she uses many of the techniques she learned from him.

title: orochimaru_(naruto)
body:
[[Naruto]] villain.

He is one of the Legendary Sannin along with [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] and [[Jiraiya (naruto)|]], all of whom trained under [[Sarutobi Hiruzen]] (The Third Hokage).

He has a subordinate in the form of Medical Ninja [[Yakushi Kabuto]] since moving to the Hidden Sound Village, wanting to find a new body for his soul.

It was then revealed that he wanted Hidden Leaf renegade [[Uchiha Sasuke]], who now moved to the Hidden Sound, as his vessel in the events of [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuden]].

His animal motif is a [[snake]], often seen by extending his neck to plant a Curse Mark on someone. He wields a weapon called the [[Sword of Kusanagi]] which he can either wield from his hand or, in the events of Shippuuden, spit out from inside his body. He has a giant snake that he can summon named Manda.

title: tsunade_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)
body:
Also known as Ogata Tsunade. A character from [[Jiraiya Gouketsu Monogatari]].

She is a mysterious beauty with superhuman strength who can use a xian magic to summon giant slugs. 

Jiraiya's toad, Orochimaru's snake and Tsunade's slug became the origin of "a Japanese idiom for ”three-way deadlock”":[http://tangorin.com/general/%E4%B8%89%E7%AB%A6%E3%81%BF]. (In Japanese folklore a slug is the natural enemy of snakes.)

h4.See also

* [[Ogata Shuuma Hiroyuki]] (Jiraiya)
* [[Orochimaru_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)|]]
* [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] ([[Naruto]]) - Her counterpart in Naruto
* [[ninja]] - Later, their xian magics became considered as a type of ninja arts.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tsunade":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsunade

title: gaara_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto]] who fights with [[sand]]. His older siblings are [[kankurou (naruto)|Kankurou]] and [[Temari (naruto)|]]. The sign on his forehead means ''love''. 

[spoiler]
Firstly villain who just loved himself. Thanks to [[Uzumaki Naruto]] he learned true friendship.
[/spoiler]

He is then promoted to the title of Fifth Kazekage in the [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuuden]] timeline, and hopes to protect the village from any sign of destructions or villainy, but was ultimately defeated by Akatsuki member [[Deidara (naruto)|]]. Deidara and the rest of the Akatsuki would later seal the Shuukaku inside Gaara with the Genryuu Kyuu Fuujin.

title: zetsu_(naruto)
body: A villain from the [[Naruto]] manga and anime series. Member of the [[akatsuki_(naruto)|Akatsuki]] group of criminals. Looks like a carnivorous plant and has two personalities.

title: hidan_(naruto)
body: A villain from the [[Naruto]] manga and anime series. Member of the Akatsuki group of criminals.

title: kakuzu_(naruto)
body: A villain from the [[Naruto]] manga and anime series. Member of the Akatsuki group of criminals.

title: tayuya_(naruto)
body:
A villain from [[Naruto]] who goes by the title [b]Tayuya of the North Gate[/b] (北門の多由也 [i]Hokumon no Tayuya[/i]).

She is the sole female of the Sound Four manipulates demons of her creation using her Demon [[Flute]]. She can also manipulate said flute into projectiles and force fields.

title: kankurou_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto]].

He is a puppet master of the Hidden Sand Village, as is often depicted with his signature four-armed [[puppet]] named Karasu. As the series progresses, he gains another puppet, an insectoid puppet with a horse-like head named Kuroari; and a third one in [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuuden]], a newt-like puppet who can breathe fire named Sanshouou.

He is the first son of the Fourth Kazekage, and the second child among the other Sand siblings ([[Gaara (naruto)|]] and [[Temari (naruto)|]]).

title: sennin_mode
body:
a.k.a. Sage Mode

An empowered state which enhances a user's abilities. Users of a perfected Sage Mode will gain pigmentations around their eyes, with some changes on their irides. 

An imperfect Sage Mode, however, will result in the user also gaining animalistic traits. 

Sage Mode users include: 

[[Uzumaki Naruto]] (Perfect)
[spoiler][[Namikaze Minato]] (Perfect)[/spoiler]
[spoiler][[Senju Hashirama]] (Perfect)[/spoiler]
[[Jiraiya (naruto)|]] (Imperfect)
[spoiler][[Yakushi Kabuto]] (Perfect)[/spoiler]

Variations of this state also exists: A combination with the Tailed Beast Mode (Tailed Beast Sage Mode) and [spoiler]an advanced version gifted by [[Ootsutsuki Hagoromo]] (Six Paths Sage Mode).
[/spoiler]

title: namikaze_minato
body:
[[Naruto]] character also known by his nickname of [b]The Yellow Flash[/b] (黄色い閃光, [i]kiiroi senkou[/i]).

He is the deceased father of [[Uzumaki Naruto]] who was also taught the Rasengan by [[Jiraiya (naruto)|]].

title: might_guy
body:
[[Naruto]] character.

He looks exactly like an adult version of [[Rock Lee]] albeit with eyes that are almost shut as an emphasis for his age. As per the other Hidden Leaf mentors, he wears a special green Hidden Leaf vest.

He is the mentor of Lee, [[Hyuuga Neji]], and [[Tenten (naruto)|]], the four of whom form Team Guy.

He is famous for his Self Rule book, in which he makes up his own rules and punishments (in case he screws the rules), and is often considered a joke character in the series.

title: jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari
body:
(じらいやごうけつものがたり, "The Tale of the Gallant Jiraiya")

A long-running, unfinished 19th century "kusazoushi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kusaz%C5%8Dshi] novel series written by Mizugaki Egao and his inheritor authors. Illustrated by seven [[ukiyo-e]] artists, including "Utagawa Kunisada":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunisada].

"Kawatake Mokuami":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawatake_Mokuami] wrote a kabuki drama based on the first ten parts of the novel.

Although the toad-riding thief Jiraiya first appeared in Kan'wa-tei Onitake's Jiraiya Monogatari, Mizugaki's Gouketsu Monogatari is regarded as a great popularizer of Jiraiya's name. His archnemesis, Orochimaru, and his wife, Tsunade, originated from this series.

h4.Characters

* Jiraiya, aka. [[Ogata Shuuma Hiroyuki]]
* [[tsunade_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)|Tsunade]], aka. Ogata Tsunade
* [[orochimaru_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)|Orochimaru]]
* [[NARUTO]] - Some characters' names and "one of the episode titles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Naruto:_Shippuden_episodes_%28season_6%29#ep133] originated from the novel.

h4. External links

title: s.m.s.
body:
A fictional para[[military]] organization from the [[Macross Frontier]] science fiction anime TV series and its movie adaptations. It also appears in the [[Macross 30]] console video game.

[b]S.M.S.[/b] ([i]Strategic Military Services[/i]) is a special mercenary company or private army that serves as a civilian military provider or private military contractor for the [[N.U.N.S.]] forces. 

Its main base of operations is the [[Macross Quarter]] space warship in the Macross Frontier fleet. 

Some of its tactical units include the [i]Skull[/i] Team and the all-[[Meltrandi]] [i]Pixie[/i] Team. Most of its members are former N.U.N.S. ace pilots and/or experienced Human and [[Zentradi]] veterans and soldiers. 

In the Macross Frontier TV series this organization was the first to deploy the new [[VF-25]] variable fighter [[mecha]] to test them in field conditions before being officially adopted by the N.U.N.S. Other equipment used by this private army are the [[Queadluun-Rea]] [[power armor]] and the [[EX-Gear]] [[power suit]].

title: boeing_727
body:
The Boeing 727 is a narrow-body, short range jet airliner.

The aircraft uses a low-wing, T-tail configuration. It has three engines mounted in the rear. The central engine gets its air through an S-duct with an opening at the base of the tailfin. The 727 is also known for its rear-mounted airstairs, which were famously used by the hijacker D. B. Cooper to escape from the aircraft.

First flying in 1963, the 727 saw its heyday in the 1970s and 80s. It was the most-produced jet airliner for over a decade, seeing service all over the world. The majority of 727s were retired by the 2000s, but some are still flying today.

h4. See also

title: strider_sheena
body:
A character from the [[Strider_(video game)|]] science fiction franchise. She appears in the 1988 Strider manga as well as its 1989 [[NES]] video game adaptation.

[b]Sheena[/b] (シーナ) is a female Strider who has been friends with both [[Strider Hiryuu]] and [[Strider Kain]] since training school, and is often teamed with them on missions. Contrasting Kain's more relaxed attitude, she is shown silent and [[serious]] most of the time.

Sheena is perhaps not as deadly or combat capable as Hiryuu and Kain, but quite proficient with many types of firearms and long range weaponry, specially sub[[machine gun]]s.

title: sun_group_(printing_company)
body:
Japanese professional printing company. Prominent among the doujin (fanwork) scene as it provides dedicated printing and binding services for doujinshi authors. Often credited in the higher-budgeted doujinshi fanzines as the printer of the work.

The company's logo is a stylized smiling sun (which rotates in animated versions). This logo will usually appear in the [[colophon]] (i.e. publication info imprint) section on the [[credits page]] at the end of a doujin comic.

title: alphago
body: Read as AlphaGo. [[Google]] DeepMind's [[Go (board game)|]] playing computer program which became the first to beat a professional human player without handicaps in October 2015 and won "a series versus Lee Se-dol":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AlphaGo_versus_Lee_Sedol] in March 2016. Se-dol had a 9-dan rank and was second in international titles at the time. AlphaGo was given an honorary 9-dan rank for the win.

Her two partners are [[Chachazero]] and [[Karakuri Chachamaru|Chachamaru]]. She vows revenge against [[Nagi Springfield]].

She appears again in her [[Evangeline A.K. McDowell (adult)|adult form]] in [[UQ Holder!]], most commonly called Yukihime (雪姫).

title: orthocone
body:
[i]'[[Nautilus_(animal)|]]', but with a long straight cone-shaped shell.[/i]

An extinct nautiloid cephalopod. Often found in fossils in real life, in different places distributed throughout the world. Traditionally, all nautiloids with an "orthocone" shell were grouped under the genus [i]Orthoceras[/i], though current research has revealed them to belong to different groups and orders.

Use this tag for depictions of nautilus-like cephalopods with long straight shells.

h4. Notable examples
* [[Lunga Ocean Heavy Cruiser Princess]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
** Wields a metallic orthocone as a lance.
** Has mechanical orthocone familiars acting as her gun turrets.

body:
Character in [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]

She lost both of her legs in the accident (and, in the first anime, also lost one arm). [[dominic lecoulte|Dominic]] took her in as if she was his own daughter and took care of her. He gave her automail limbs to replace the ones she lost.

title: flying_spittle
body:
The saliva analogue of [[flying teardrops]] and [[flying sweatdrops]].

Use this tag when there are multiple discrete drops of saliva flying out of a character's mouth (or equivalent organ). This is likely to be depicted when a character is giving another one a stern scolding, or when gorging on food, or when getting punched in the face or stomach.

Avoid using this tag when [[spitting]], [[spit_take]] or [[sneezing]] would be more appropriate. Though some examples may qualify for both.
Also avoid using this tag when the substance in question is not saliva (i.e. most [[spit take]] examples).

h4. See also
* [[Saliva]]
* [[Spitting]]
* [[Spit take]]
** Usually involves other liquids instead of saliva.
* [[Sneezing]]
** Usually depicted as a conical 'spray' instead of droplets.
* [[Saliva trail]]

title: daruma_doll
body:
A [b]Daruma doll[/b] (だるま) is a hollow, round, Japanese [[doll]] that are seen as a symbol of perseverance and good luck, making them a popular gift of encouragement. The eyes of Daruma are often blank. The recipient of the doll fills in one eye upon setting a goal or wish, then the other upon fulfilling it. In this way, every time they see the one-eyed Daruma, they recall the goal.

Should not be confused with [[quadruple amputee]], which will often use the 達磨 tag on pixiv.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Daruma doll":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daruma_doll]

title: grawlix
body: [b]Grawlix[/b] is meaningless typographical gibberish used by cartoonists as a stand-in for unprintable dialogue (usually profanity, but sometimes just meant to convey unintelligible incoherence on the part of the speaking character).  The term (originally a numerate singular; plural [i]grawlixes[/i]) was coined by American cartoonist Mort Walker, creator of [i]Beetle Bailey[/i], in a 1964 satire for the National Cartoonists Society entitled "Let's Get Down to Grawlixes".  Walker later expanded on the theme in a 1980 book, [i]The Lexicon of Comicana[/i], in which he coined "technical" terms for other common visual shorthands, such as [i]plewds[/i] ([[flying sweatdrops]]) and [i]emanata[/i] ([[^^^]]).

title: anaglyph
body:
Anaglyph images are used to provide a stereoscopic 3D effect, when viewed with 2 color glasses (each lens a chromatically opposite color, usually red and cyan). Images are made up of two color layers, superimposed, but offset with respect to each other to produce a depth effect. Usually the main subject is in the center, while the foreground and background are shifted laterally in opposite directions. The picture contains two differently filtered colored images, one for each eye. When viewed through the "color coded" "3D glasses", they reveal an integrated stereoscopic image. The visual cortex of the brain fuses this into perception of a three dimensional scene or composition.

Not to be confused with the much more common [[chromatic aberration]], which is visually similar to [[anaglyph]], but is not intended to create a stereoscopic image.  [[Chromatic aberration]] typically offsets color layers of the entire image uniformly, whereas true [[anaglyph]] offsets foreground and background differently to create the 3D effect.  In real life photography, [[chromatic aberration]] is naturally caused by lens problems.

h4.See also

* [[chromatic aberration]]
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anaglyph_3D]
* [[3D Glasses]]
* [[Stereogram]]

title: mononoke_hime
body:
[b]Princess Mononoke[/b] (Japanese: もののけ姫, [i]Mononoke-Hime/Monster Princess/Spirit Princess[/i]) is a 1997 Japanese animated epic historical [[fantasy]] film written and directed by [[miyazaki_hayao_(person)|Miyazaki Hayao]], animated by Studio Ghibli and produced by Suzuki Toshio.

"Mononoke" (物の怪?) actually is not a name, but a general term in the Japanese language for a spirit or monster. 

The film was first released in Japan on July 12, 1997, and in the United States on October 29, 1999.

Princess Mononoke is a period drama set specifically in the late Muromachi period of Japan but with numerous fantastical elements. The story concentrates on the involvement of the outsider [[Ashitaka]] in the struggle between the supernatural guardians of a forest and the humans of the Iron Town who consume its resources. 

h4. See also

* [[San (mononoke hime)|]]

title: singlish_text
body:
Images that contain text written [i]noticeably[/i] in Singlish, a colloquial form of English spoken in Singapore. Singlish often incorporates loanwords from Chinese (Mandarin and others) and Malay, and may also contain phrases from Tamil.

Due to geographical and shared cultural reasons, some varieties of colloquial Malaysian English (i.e. "Manglish") can be very similar to Singlish. Manglish as spoken in most parts of Western Peninsular Malaysia is often nearly indistinguishable from Singlish (i.e. can only be inferred by meta knowledge of the character's nationality). As such, these examples can also be tagged "Singlish".

h4. Notable examples
* [[Sar-21 (girls'_frontline)|]] ([[Girls' Frontline]])
** Android "T-Doll" bonded to a Singaporean [[SAR-21]] assault rifle.
** May sometimes be depicted speaking in Singlish, especially if drawn by Singaporean or Malaysian artists.
*** e.g. post #3673523

h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag Singlish for [i]noticeable[/i] examples of Singlish in text.
** Try to avoid tagging Singlish for light colloquialisms like one or two odd spellings or grammar/syntax. These examples can be nearly indistinguishable from typos or from other colloquial forms of English.
*** Though, generally, if it feels distinctively [i]Singlish[/i] enough (speakers of Singlish/Manglish should know what I mean), it should be tagged.
*** Anything that warrants a translation note probably deserves to be tagged Singlish.
* Tag Singlish for [i]noticeable[/i] examples of Manglish in text that highly resembles Singlish.
** Follow similar guidelines as for Singlish above.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Singlish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singlish]
* "Wikipedia: Manglish":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manglish]

Light novel series by Tokuyama Gintarou, with illustrations by [[Yomu_(sgt_epper)|]]. 

Premise of the story is exactly as described by the title and 'sub-title'. 'Nuff said.

[expand=Notes on title terminology]
LN title: 厳しい女上司が高校生に戻ったら俺にデレデレする理由
[tn]"The Reason Why My Strict Female Boss Turned Deredere on Me After Turning Back into a High School Student"[/tn]
Sub-title: 両片思いのやり直し高校生生活
[tn]"High School Life Where We Redo Our Mutual Crushes"[/tn]
* Promotional materials and book lists tend to just use the title part alone. 
* Volume numbering is always done after the title. 
* If the sub-title is attached, it comes after the volume number.
* The current Danbooru tag is a romanization of the title part, with the 'subtitle' omitted.[/expand]

title: teke-teke
body:
Creepypasta story about a schoolgirl who became a vengeful spirit after having the bottom half of her body sliced off by a train (right across the middle of the torso). Variants as to how that happened include getting tied to the tracks by school bullies, or being pushed, or just a simple accidental fall. 

Without her legs, the Teke-Teke can 'only' move by dragging herself along with her upper arms, causing a distinctive "teke-teke" scratching noise from which she gets her name. Some variants have her 'walk' by using her arms as legs, but she usually still makes that scratching noise.

The Teke-Teke's modus operandi is to ambush isolated victims at night to slice them in half across the torso (emulating her death). This is often done with a Grim Reaper-style scythe. 

The Teke-Teke is usually depicted as a girl in a Japanese [[school uniform|schoolgirl uniform]] (often bloodied) with her lower half missing. Some depictions will also have an exposed lower spine jutting out at where her torso was cut in half. The Teke-Teke is usually armed with a [[scythe]], or less commonly, a long [[knife]] or some other bladed weapon.

When written in Japanese, the Teke-Teke creepypasta/character is almost always written in katakana, as テケテケ.

h4. See also
* [b]Sacchan[/b]
** Almost identical urban legend, except without the "teke-teke" onomatopoeia.
** Always spelled in katakana (サッチャン) when referring to the urban legend.
* [b]Kashima-san/Kashima Reiko[/b]
** Related, older urban legend of a dismembered vengeful spirit. 
** Some variants have Kashima committing suicide by throwing herself onto the train tracks (after being raped by American soldiers), meeting a similar fate as the Teke-Teke. This version is sometimes regarded as the origin of the Teke-Teke creepypasta.
** Always spelled in katakana (カシマさん、カシマレイコ) when referring to the urban legend.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Teke Teke":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teke_Teke]

title: md5_mismatch
body:
A post that doesn't exactly match the post at the source.

A post can be a MD5 mismatch for several possible reasons:

* The file was modified by the uploader, for example, by editing it or resaving it. Uploaders shouldn't modify files.
* The file was [[revision|revised]] by the artist. The revised version may be uploaded as a new post.
* The file is an [[image sample]]. Ask for the file to be replaced with the full version in topic #16765.
* The file was modified by the source site, for example, by recompressing it to a lower quality. Nothing can be done here.
* The source is not where the file originally came from. The uploader got the file from a different source. The source should be changed to point to the original source.

An MD5 hash is a signature used to tell if two files are the same. Two files with the same MD5 hash are exactly the same. Two files with different MD5 hashes are different files, even if they look the same. They may have differences that can't be seen by the naked eye, such as different image compression or quality levels, or different image metadata.

This tag is added automatically by a bot.

h4. See also

* [[bad id]]
* [[image sample]]
* [[resized]]
* [[resolution mismatch]]
* [[revision]]
* [[has bad revision]]

title: rca_connector
body:
A connector commonly used for audio and video signals, sometimes called Cinch connector. Comes in various colors.

Plugs have a single prong in the middle and a metallic ring around it, which may be fully visible or mostly covered in the plug’s plastic housing. Jacks are metallic all around and have colored plastic with a hole in the middle. They are commonly used for tape and CD players, game consoles, VHS recorders and DVD players from before the digital HD video era. Signals are always analog, except for S/PDIF digital audio, which uses only a single connector.

Connectors usually come in differently colored sets of two, three or five. White and red (sometimes black and red) for left and right channel stereo audio; yellow, white and red for composite video and stereo audio; red, green and blue for RGB or YPbPr component video with no audio; or red, green and blue, white and another red for component video and stereo audio.

h4. Examples

* post #2354973 - yellow and white for composite video and mono audio
* post #2599908 (top right) - yellow, white and red for composite video and stereo audio
* post #3254831 - yellow, white and red for composite video and stereo audio
* post #3546259 - white and red for stereo audio

h4. See also

* [[audio jack]] for headphones and microphones

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: RCA connector":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RCA_connector]

title: audio_jack
body:
A connector commonly used for audio equipment. Sometimes called a headphone jack, jack plug, phone jack, or phone connector.

Almost all [[headphones]], [[microphone]]s and most consumer [[speaker]]s have one of these connectors. Consumer equipment usually has the small 3.5 mm plug and professional equipment has the large 6.35 mm plug. Electric guitars and effects units always use the 6.35 mm plug.

Plugs have a single prong with separately connected tip, sleeve, and usually one ring, sometimes more. Mono audio has no ring, often found on microphones; stereo audio has one ring and headsets with integrated microphones or control buttons have two or more rings.

h4. Examples

* post #3788806 - 6.35 mm variant with tip, ring and sleeve for stereo audio
* post #2684511 - 3.5 mm variant with tip, ring and sleeve
* post #2331144 - 3.5 mm variant with tip, two rings and sleeve

h4. See also

* [[RCA connector]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Phone connector":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phone_connector_(audio)]

title: criminal_scum!_(meme)
body:
[i]"Stop right there, [b]criminal scum![/b]"[/i]

One of the possible generic lines uttered by a [[guard_(oblivion)|guard in Oblivion]] when interrupting the player's crime in progress (usually lockpicking). Meme'd because of its authoritative shock value. Particularly when the player gets surprised by an unseen guard from the back.

Often shortened to just "criminal scum", especially in permutations of the meme (e.g. "Criminal scum sense, TINGLING!"). 

Translated as 「大人しくしろ、犯罪者のクズめ！」 in the Japanese version of Oblivion. Japanese fans use multiple different translations for the first part of the phrase, but the 「犯罪者のクズめ」part generally remains consistent.

h4. Notable examples
* Post #3108020

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Stop right there, criminal scum!":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/stop-right-there-criminal-scum]

title: guard
body:
Someone whose job is guarding a place. And is wearing the appropriate uniform. Tend to wear [[armor]] and wield [[polearm]]s. Often just background characters to set a scene (literally, by standing in the back), or mooks guarding an entrance that the hero must bypass.

Sometimes also called "watchmen".

[[Fantasy]]/[[Medieval]]/[[Renaissance]]: City guards, palace guards, noble's mansion guards, etc.

For the modern variants, use [[bodyguard]] or [[security guard]].

Avoid using the guard tag for fantasy bodyguards, as they tend to dress like knights or normal soldiers (and are functionally such, in the case of a noble's "household" guard), or be out of uniform.

h4. Notable examples:
* [[Guard (Skyrim)|]] ([[the_elder_scrolls_v:_skyrim|Skyrim]])
** Generic city guard from  [[the_elder_scrolls_v:_skyrim|Skyrim]]. Often depicted dressed in the colors and equipment of the Whiterun Hold Guard.
** Heavily associated with the [[Arrow to the knee]] meme.
* [[Guard (Oblivion)|]] ([[the_elder_scrolls_iv:_oblivion|Oblivion]])
** Generic city guard from [[the_elder_scrolls_iv:_oblivion|Oblivion]]. Often depicted dressed in the colors and armor of the Imperial City Guard.
** Heavily associated with the [[Criminal scum!_(meme)|]] meme.

title: gorogoro_(sfx)
body:
ごろごろ
[i]*Roll roll...*[/i]

Japanese onomatopoeia for the sound of rolling. Most often used to express the *rumbling* sound of "rolling" thunder in the distance, and as such is the usual go to SFX for *bad weather*.  

h4. Other uses include:  
* Rumbling sound. Less intense than *gogogo*
* SFX for a 'rolling' action, even if it's soundless.
* SFX for 'idling away time'. As though someone is lying on the ground, rolling to-and-fro doing nothing.
** Often this is accompanied with literal rolling.
* 'SFX' for someone or something with a "roly-poly" figure. Most often a fat, small-sized dog.
* A growling sound.
* A purring sound.


Variants include *koro koro*, *goron goron* and multiple different permutations of *goro*, *goron* and *koro* (and other variants). Use this same tag for all of them.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Ikazuchi_(Kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
** Often associated with her as a pun on her name (i.e. *rolling Thunder*).

title: leopard_1
body:
The original "main battle [[tank]]" of West Germany. As developments in high-powered HEAT shells meant that heavily armored tanks were little more than sitting ducks, the Leopard was designed to be quite lightly armored but nimble and agile, while carrying the fantastic 105mm L7 gun that enabled it to defeat any armored vehicle it were to face. It was later supplanted in German service by the [[Leopard 2]].

title: augustus

[i]Gaius Julius Caesar[/i] (after adoption. Same as his great-uncle). Usually called "Octavian" by historians to avoid confusion with his uncle.

[[Julius Caesar|Caesar]]'s heir and first emperor of Rome. Founded the Roman Empire. His reign was an era of relative peace known as the [i]Pax Romana[/i].

Augustus is his title, and is how historians refer to him after he obtained said title starting 27 BC.

[i]*crickets...*[/i]

Chinese also has a similar onomatopoeia as "静... " (jin...), with a similar sound. This is sometimes also used to translate the Japanese しーん. If you feel it is appropriate, you may tag such examples also with shiin_(sfx).

title: stola
body:
Female equivalent of the [[toga]]. A distinctively Roman outer garment, generally only worn by Roman matrons. 

The robe 'worn' by the [[Statue of Liberty]] is a stola.

h4. Notable examples

* [[Statue of Liberty]]
** Depiction of the Roman Goddess Libertas ("Liberty").
** Wears a stola over a long [[chiton]] worn as a slip ("underdress"), with a palla worn as a [[shawl]] on top.
** Generally only the stola is visually discernible in most of her depictions. Avoid tagging her other two garments.
*** When the stola can be visibly discerned ('frills' running diagonally from her left shoulder to her right hip), this is generally enough to tag stola and [[robe]].
*** The [[chiton]] may be visible poking underneath the stola 'frills', near the feet region.
**** In such cases, tag [[chiton]] too. And perhaps [[long_dress]].
*** The [[chiton]] may be visible on her right shoulder, poking out of the stola (which leaves her right shoulder uncovered). It may be hard to discern the lines though because the palla also covers that region.
**** In such cases, tag [[chiton]] too.
*** The palla may be visible, worn as a shawl over the shoulders. 
**** In such cases, tag [[shawl]] too. There is no specific tag for the palla yet.
**** Note that most drawn/photo depictions of the Statue generally do not have enough detail to discern the palla.

title: calico_m950
body:
The Calico series are submachine guns (along with the civilian semi-automatic pistol and carbine versions) produced by Calico Light Weapons Systems. The M100/M110 series are fire .22 Long Rifle rounds, while the M750/M900/M950/M960 series fire 9x19mm. The 9x19mm versions were later renamed the Calico Liberty I, II, and III. All versions use proprietary helical box magazines with a capacity of 50 or 100 rounds mounted on top, and shell casings are ejected out the bottom similar to the [[P90]].

While civilian semi-automatic sales have been limited and attempt to market the submachine guns to military and law enforcement have been unsuccessful, the Calico series are somewhat popular in science fiction due to their futuristic appearance.

h4. See also:

* [[list of weapons]]
* [[submachine gun]]
* [[PP-19 Bizon]]
* [[M950A (Girls' Frontline)]].

Apply this tag when all members (with or without RO-635) present.

[spoiler]Said squad was considered defunct for a time when, at the end of Chapter 10, AR-15 remained lost, M16A1 had gone missing (and been 'converted' to SF, unbeknownst to anyone) and RO635 was temporarily killed by the military.

title: m4a1_dd
body:
[[Kantai Collection]] [[fairy (kancolle)|equipment fairy]] representing an American [[M4 Sherman]] tank modified by the British to be amphibious, through the addition of twin propellers and a "flotation screen" (waterproofed canvas on a lightweight, collapsible frame) that increased its effective displacement. The fairy herself has blonde hair and wears the rounded, olive-green helmet of Allied soldiers in WWII.

The "official art":https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/kancolle/images/3/32/M4A1_DD_355_Card.png/revision/latest?cb=20190830162058 contains a historical inaccuracy in that the fairy is shown sitting on top of the flotation screen.  In reality, the screens were open on top and were not rigid.

Not to be confused with the [[M4 carbine]] battle rifle, or [[m4a1 (girls' frontline)|its personification in Girls' Frontline]].

h4. Further Information

title: casting_spell
body:
The act of casting a spell. Often comes with visible manifestations of [[magic]], such as [[light particles|glowing particles]], magical [[aura]]s, runic [[magic circle]]s, and/or a ball of energy (e.g. [[fireball]]) being gathered and shaped in the caster's hand or a wielded tool.

Chanting spell incantations may also sometimes count, even if there is no overt visible manifestation of magic. This depends on context: most fantasy examples count, while people doing the same in a magic-less setting generally do not. Basically it has to be an actual [i]spell[/i] (explicitly or implied in context) to qualify.

title: yotsuwari-bishi
body:
[tn]"Quartered Rhombus", "Takeda Rhombus"[/tn]

A Japanese "quartered rhombus" geometric pattern. Consists of a rhombus pointing downward/upward (resembling an upright diamond), divided into four smaller rhombuses by lines or breaks in the pattern. May sometimes occur as a repeating element in design.

The historical Takeda clan's [[family crest]] uses the same pattern for its simplified form, so this pattern is also sometimes known as the "Takeda-bishi" (Takeda Rhombus).

title: golem_rider_alef
body:
Alef is an alchemist who makes golems out of woods.

An aesthetic who covets beauty. Though it's not quite easy for other people to understand, he has his own sets of "philosophies" on appreciation of beauty. Not only does he appreciate the outer beauty but he also recognizes the inner beauty that's "reflected on" one's looks. He has his own "Lady Radar" and believes one that is ugly on the inside cannot make the radar ring, however beautiful on the outside. When he finds "the real beauty," he willingly becomes a loyal servant of it.

His full name he used back at home was Alefiod. He was the smart one in the prestigious alchemist family, but he always made some trouble with his laziness and fondness for women. His talents had been wasted on creating a gem as a gift for a neighborhood sweetheart, or creating a golem to do all his chores, and such. 

When a war broke out with a neighboring country, he created the ultimate golem out of birch woods at the request of the royal family and successfully protected the country. Thinking golem's powers as an opportunity, the royals tried to start another war. He persistently refused to use his golem for war and was eventually exiled eternally. After leaving his country, he vowed to start a new life and named himself Alef.

One of the many talking fish(es) that lives in the G-Spring where the [[G-Spring Goddess (ishiyumi)|]] dwells. Named Chuchumy by the Goddess, after [[Raraiya Monday]]'s [[Chuchumy|pet goldfish]]. Other characters refer to it as "Mr. Fishy".

All the Spring fish(es) are called Chuchumy by the Goddess, so only use this tag when one of the Fishes acts like a 'character' (speaking or visibly reacting counts), and/or when [spoiler]it takes on the form of a humanoid 'fish girl' who shares an uncanny resemblance with Raraiya Monday.[/spoiler].

title: choukou_senki_kikaiou
body:
[b]Choukou Senki Kikaiou[/b], (released elsewhere in the world as [b]Tech Romancer[/b]) is a 1998 3D fighting [[arcade]] [[video game]] by [[Capcom]] that draws heavily from the various sub-genres of [[Mecha]] anime. 

In the game the player controls a giant robot which is used to fight another robot in one-on-one combat. [[Kawamori Shouji]] and the rest of Studio Nue (the animation studio responsible for the mechanical designs from many robot anime series including [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]], [[Top wo Nerae!]], and [[Gundam 0083|Mobile Suit Gundam 0083: Stardust Memory]]) designed the robots in this game.

It was ported to the [[Sega Dreamcast]] console later in the same year.

h4.See also

* [[Kikaioh]]

h4.Related links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tech_Romancer

title: galaxy_force
body:
[b]Galaxy Force[/b] is a sprite-scaling rail shooter [[science fiction]] arcade [[video game]], released by [[Sega]] in 1988 and built upon the Sega Y Board. 

The game which is in the tradition of Sega's successful [[Space Harrier]] is set in space. It was ported in 1989 to the [[Sega Master System]] and in 1990 to the [[Sega Mega Drive]]/Genesis, Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum, FM Towns, [[Sega Saturn]] and [[PlayStation 2]] platforms.

Two other slighty modified versions of the arcade game were released as [b]Galaxy Force II Deluxe Edition[/b] and [b]Galaxy Force Super Deluxe Edition[/b]. Galaxy Force II was also released on the [[Wii]] Virtual Console via Sega Genesis/Mega Drive in Japan on February 3, 2009, in Europe on May 1, 2009 and in North America on May 11, 2009. Galaxy Force II was released on [[Nintendo 3DS]] as part of the 3D Classics series. It was released in July 2013 in Japan and in December 2013 in Australia, Europe and North America.

h4. See also

* [[TRY-Z]] Starfighter
other_names: ギャラクシーフォース

title: tenchi_wo_kurau_ii
body:
Full name: [i][b]Tenchi wo Kurau II - Shokatsu Koumei Den[/b][/i] lit. "The Devouring of Heaven and Earth II: The Story of Kong Ming".

A strategy role-playing game published on the [[Famicom]] in 1991 by Capcom, based on the [i]Tenchi Wo Kurau[/i] manga by Mitomiya Hiroshi. The game series and the manga itself are based on [i]The Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/i] novel by Luo Guanzhong. 

It was a Japan-exclusive sequel to [i][b]Tenchi wo Kurau I[/b][/i] (released in the US as [i][b]Destiny of an Emperor[/b][/i] in the [[NES]] and [i][b]Dinasty Wars[/b][/i] at the arcades), following Liu Bei and his allies in their struggle to unite ancient China.

[i][b]Tenchi wo Kurau II[/b][/i] was later recreated and released as an action beat'em up [[arcade]] game by [[Capcom]] in 1992 and renamed [b][i]Warriors of Fate[/i][/b] outside of Japan.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Tenchi wo Kurau II":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tenchi_wo_Kurau_II
* "Wikipedia: Warriors of Fate":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Warriors_of_Fate
* "Wikipedia: Destiny of an Emperor":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Destiny_of_an_Emperor

title: dragon_quest_x
body:
[i]Dragon Quest X: Mezameshi Itsutsu no Shuzoku Online[/i] (ドラゴンクエストX 目覚めし五つの種族 オンライン) (Dragon Quest X: Rise of the Five Tribes Online) is the tenth game in the wildly-popular (in Japan) [i][[Dragon Quest]][/i] series of RPGs. Since its launch in 2012, the game has been released on the Nintendo Wii, Wii U, the 3DS and Switch, as well as the PlayStation 4, Android & iOS, and Windows.

Unlike previous games in the series, [i]Dragon Quest X[/i] is an MMO, although an offline version was announced in 2021. The player can create a character who is a member of one of the game world's five tribes, and partner with other characters to undertake quests and progress the game's story.

title: buchi_holes
body:
[tn]"Buchi Ana" "Izubuchi Holes"[/tn]
[code]
●   ●   ● 
  ●   ●[/code]

Pattern of five (sometimes more) vent-like holes arranged in a trapezoidal formation in two offset rows, a 'trademark' design element often found on [[mecha]] designs by [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]. Usually arranged in a pattern of three above and two below (3+2), as shown above. Often found in pairs along the sides of mecha head units, or on the shoulder pauldrons. The [[AV-98 Ingram]] features them on both its head (3+2, rotated) and shoulder (3+4) units.

h4. Notable 'characters'

* [[AV-98 Ingram]] ([[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]])
** Buchi Holes along the sides of its head and shoulder 'pauldrons'.
** The similarly named  [[AV-98 Ingram Unit 2]] [b]does not[/b] have these holes.
* [[Hygogg|MSM-03C Hygogg]] ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]])
** Buchi Holes along the front of its shoulder 'pauldrons'.
* [[Z'Gok-E|MSM-07E Z'Gok-E]] ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]])
** Buchi Holes on upper forearms and 'kneecaps'.
** The original [[Z'Gok|MSM-07 Z'Gok]] does not have these holes.
* [[Guncannon MP Type|RX-77D Guncannon Mass Production Type]]  ([[gundam_0080|Gundam 0080: War in the Pocket]]) 
** Buchi Holes along the front of its shoulder 'pauldrons'.
** The original  [[Guncannon|RX-77-2 Guncannon]]  does not have these holes.
* [[G-Spring Goddess (Ishiyumi)|]] ("The Goddess of the G-Spring":[/pools/17110])
** Carries a staff with two floating fins with Buchi Holes on each.
** Sometimes 'cosplays' as the [[Hygogg]], wearing shoulder pauldrons or 'skirt' flaps with Buchi Holes.

h4. Tag usage notes

* Tag buchi_holes when you see a visible pattern of five holes arranged in the pattern noted above. 
** The pattern may be rotated at an angle, such as seen on the [[AV-98 Ingram|Ingram]]'s head unit.
* Consider tagging buchi_holes when you see a similar pattern of seven or more holes, if they are 'aesthetically' similar to the five-hole version.
** e.g. The seven hole pattern on the [[AV-98 Ingram|Ingram]]'s shoulder 'pauldrons'.
* Avoid tagging buchi_holes for patterns with an even number of holes. These often tend to be 'speaker grille' units.
* Avoid tagging buchi_holes for patterns with 3 or less holes.
* Avoid tagging buchi_holes for patterns [b]not[/b] arranged in two rows, i.e. all in one row or in three or more rows.
* If you encounter a pattern of holes that you feel fits the general 'aesthetics' of Buchi Holes, you may disregard all the above "avoid" clauses and tag them buchi_holes anyway. But please be 'conservative' in this regard.

title: mq-8_fire_scout
body:
The MQ-8 Fire Scout is an [[UAV|unmanned autonomous]] [[helicopter]] developed by Northrop Grumman for use by the United States Armed Forces. The Fire Scout is designed to provide reconnaissance, situational awareness, aerial fire support and precision targeting support for ground, air and sea forces.

h4. Specifications

* Crew: 0
* Capacity: 600 lb (272 kg)
* Length: 23 ft 11.4 in (7.3 m)
* Wingspan: 27 ft 6 in (8.4 m)
* Height: 9 ft 8.5 in (2.9 m)
* Empty weight: 2,073 lb (940.3 kg)
* Maximum speed: 115 kn (132 mph, 213 km/h)

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia - Northrop Grumman MQ-8 Fire Scout":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northrop_Grumman_MQ-8_Fire_Scout]

title: spyglass_(titanfall)
body:
A [[Titanfall (series)|]] character who appears in [[Titanfall]] and Titanfall Online. Spyglass is a heavily modified Spectre that houses the IMC's computational network and oversees Titan deployment for the IMC.

After the events of the first game, he takes command of the IMC Remnant forces. He is  considered a rogue element, as his Remnant forces often launch attacks against other IMC Remnant groups. While he doesn't appear in [[Titanfall 2]], he is implied to be the commander of the Remnant forces encountered in the Bounty Hunt and Frontier Defense modes of the game's multiplayer.

title: eyes_of_grima
body:
Distinctive pattern of six stylized eyes associated with the [[Grima_(fire_emblem)|Fell Dragon Grima]] from [[Fire Emblem]]. This pattern is sometimes found on clothing and tattoos worn by characters associated with the Theocracy of Plegia in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

As the 'eyes' are often split into two groups of three on either sides of a character's clothing (with only one side being visible), the presence of two to three such eyes should generally suffice to tag eyes_of_grima.

Avoid tagging this if the eyes are barely visible (i.e. not enough to visually discern a pattern), even if the character is implied to be wearing them. Also avoid tagging this for [[Grima_(Fire Emblem)|]]'s actual eyes while in dragon (or some fan-depicted humanoid) form.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Henry_(Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Eyes of Grima along inner 'collar' surface of cloak.
* [[Validar_(Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Carries a grimoire with the Eyes of Grima embossed on front cover.
* [spoiler] [[Robin_(Fire Emblem)|]][/spoiler] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Eyes of Grima along [spoiler]left and right sleeves of coat.[/spoiler]
** Brand of Grima [spoiler]'tattooed' on right hand[/spoiler],
*  [[Grima_(Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** [spoiler]Eyes of Grima along left and right sleeves of coat, while in human form.[/spoiler]
** [spoiler]Brand of Grima [spoiler]'tattooed' on right hand, while in human form.[/spoiler]
** Sometimes depicted with Eyes of Grima facial tattoos, while in human form.

This tag may refer to the ceremony, the dolls used, or the boat used.

title: three_laws_of_robotics
body:
Images that refer to [[Isaac Asimov]]'s "Three Laws of Robotics."

1) A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
2) A robot must obey the orders given it by human beings except where such orders would conflict with the First Law.
3) A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Laws.

In some later works there is a 4th law referred to as the Zeroth Law that was added that proceeds the three laws.

0) A robot may not harm humanity, or, by inaction, allow humanity to come to harm.

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia - Three Laws of Robotics":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Laws_of_Robotics]

title: psd_available
body:
For when an artist has a Photoshop Document (PSD) available at their website.  These documents are not uploadable to Danbooru, so add this tag whenever one is found.  

For any questions about the following, ask in topic #14081.

h4. Source the image post, link to the PSD otherwise

h5. Both PSD and image are available separately

* Upload the image
* Set the source on Danbooru for the image (image or post link)
* Add a comment with a link on where to get the PSD

[b]Example:[/b] post #3667430

h5. Only PSD is available

* Convert the image to a usable image format, preferably PNG, and "upload it":/uploads/new.
** Converted files should be in a lossless format like PNG unless it can't go under the 50 MB filesize limit even with optimization
* Set the source on Danbooru for the PSD (file or post link).

[b]Example:[/b] post #2662037, post #2662040

h4. See also

* [[PDF available]]
* [[Help:Image Source]]

title: pdf_available
body:
For when an artist has a Portable Document Format (PDF) available at their website.  These documents are not uploadable to Danbooru, so add this tag whenever one is found.

For any questions about the following, ask in topic #14081.

h4. Source the image post, link to the PDF otherwise

h5. Both PDF and image are available separately

* Upload the image
* Set the source on Danbooru for the image (image or post link).
* Add a comment with a link on where to get the PDF.

h5. Only PDF is available

* Convert the image to a usable image format, preferably PNG, and "upload it":/uploads/new.
** Converted files should be in a lossless format like PNG unless it can't go under the 50 MB filesize limit even with optimization
* Set the source on Danbooru for the PDF (file or post link).


h6. Recommended tools
* XPDF's pdfImages CLI
* "pdfimages.exe":[https://www.xpdfreader.com/pdfimages-man.html] on windows
* "Wikipedia: Xpdf":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xpdf]

[b]Example:[/b] post #1514123

h4. See also

* [[PSD available]]
* [[Help:Image Source]]

title: tp_(86_-eighty-six-)
body:
A minor character in the series [[86 -EightySix-]].  TP is a black [[cat]] with white paws that was a pet of the Spearhead Squadron taken in from the battlefield.  [[Vladilena Millize|Vladilena Milizé]] later adopts the cat.

The Spearhead Squadron did not give a name to the cat, with each member calling the cat whatever they felt like calling him at the given time.  Lena names the cat Thermopylae after adopting it, though the cat officially becomes referred to as TP since.

title: shinei_nouzen
body:
Shinei Nouzen, nicknamed Shin, is the male main character from the light novel series [[86 -EightySix-]].  Shin has [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]].  He frequently wears a battered white [[scarf]] around his neck to conceal the large [[scar_on_neck|scar]] on it.

Shin is an 86, one of the non-Alba race stripped of their human rights by the Republic of San Magnolia after the war with the Giadian Empire broke out and made to serve as human fodder for the Republic's war effort.  At the start of the series he is 16-years-old and the commanding officer of the Spearhead Squadron of 86ers, having already served 4 years in the Republic's military.  Officially he is ranked as Captain of Spearhead Squadron, though leadership in 86 units is based on whoever is deemed the most skilled by the rest of the unit.  His Personal Name, a name granted to veteran 86ers as their permanent call sign, is Undertaker.  His personal emblem for the [[mecha]] he pilots, a [[m1a4 juggernaut|Juggernaut]], is a headless skeleton holding a shovel, which is derived from his [[shourei_nouzen|older brother]]'s emblem which was a headless skeleton holding a sword.

title: xm2_reginleif
body:
A four-legged [[mecha]] from the series [[86 -EightySix-]].  It features white armor described as having the color of "polished bone" and usually features a large cannon on its back.  Despite the official name being Reginleif, they're commonly referred to by their pilots by the nickname Juggernaut.

The XM-2 Reginleif is a Feldreß (multi-legged armored-weapon system) developed and produced by the Federal Republic of Giad.  Based on recovered [[M1A4 Juggernaut]]s, the Reginlef is designed for speed and mobility at the expense of armor and firepower compared to the Federal Republic's other Feldreßs.  Compared to the Juggernaut though, it features significantly more armor and safety features for its pilots.  These included a fully sealed temperature controlled cockpit and armor strong enough to withstand the 7.62 mm machineguns equipped to the basic legion scout units, which could readily penetrate the armor of a Juggernaut.

h6. Specifications

* Length (w/o armaments): 6.3 m
* Height (w/o armaments ): 2.7 m
* Armaments: 
** 2x Grappling Sub Arms: High-Frequency Blades or 12.7 mm Machine Gun
** 2x Wire Anchor
** Gun Mount Arm: 88 mm Smoothbore gun, 40 mm auto-cannon, or multiple-launch rocket pad
** 4x Legs: Anti-Armor Pile Driver

title: m1a4_juggernaut
body:
A four-legged [[mecha]] from the series [[86 -EightySix-]].  It appears similar to an fighter plane body with 4 legs instead of wings and a large [[cannon]] mounted on top with its ammunition magazine hanging in the back. In series it is described as looking like a prowling spider.

The M1A4 Juggernaut is labelled as a military "drone" by the Republic of San Magnolia, though it is actually a piloted Feldreß (multi-legged armored-weapon system).  Given the official labelling as a drone, the armor and life-preserving equipment were either minimal or not present in the design.  The cockpit was enclosed by a clam-shell armored canopy, but as this prevented the pilot from seeing out they would have to depend on viewscreens for sight.  These viewscreens were of low resolution though, and so resulted in poor visibility for pilots.  The joint connecting the armored canopy was also not particularly durable, so a strong impact could dislodge the canopy from the Juggernaut.  Given the design of the cockpit this would also result in the canopy decapitating the pilot, and as such the canopy was also referred to as "the guillotine."  Due to poor quality control in their manufacturing the canopy would not form a complete seal over the cockpit, thus leaving the pilot exposed to the environment outside. 

h6. Specifications

* Length (w/o gun mount): 10.7 m
* Height (w/o gun mount): 2.1 m
* Armaments: 
** 2x Grappling Sub Arms: High-Frequency Blades or 12.7 mm Machine Guns
** 2x Wire Anchor
** Gun Mount Arm: Typically fitted with 57 mm gun

h4. See also

* [[XM2 Reginleif]]

title: wormadam
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #413 in the National PokéDex, a Bug type Pokémon whose second type depends on its cloak.
Wormadam is a black, bagworm-like Pokémon with a coat of leaves, sand, or building insulation that has fused with its body.


It has three different secondary types: Steel, Grass, and Ground, determined by the cloak that Burmy was in when it last battled. Unlike Burmy, its cloak is permanent.

* [[Wormadam (Plant)]] - Bug/Grass.
* [[Wormadam (Sandy)]] - Bug/Ground.
* [[Wormadam (Trash)]] - Bug/Steel.

See: "Bulbagarden.net":[http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Wormadam_(Pokémon)]

It evolved from female [[Burmy]].
Japanese Name: [b]Minomadam[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Burmy]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mothim]]

title: ishuzoku_reviewers
body:
[b]Ishuzoku Reviewers[/b] (異種族レビュアーズ, lit. "Interspecies Reviewers") is a manga series written by [[amahara (amahara teikoku)|Amahara]] and illustrated by [[masha]], first published in 2014, about reviewing brothels run by and filled with various girls of varied race. Undead, elves, demons, faeries all judged in their ability to satisfy by an assembly of three fantasy races and a human.

An anime adaptation debuted on January 2020, which became controversial due to its explicit sexual content, most notably [[prostitution]]. The anime was banned by mainstream networks in Japan and pulled from Funimation's website after being aired for only 3 episodes. In response, the website [i]MyAnimeList[/i] was flooded with positive reviews, which temporarily turned the show into the highest rated anime of all time on the site.

title: higashikata_josuke
body:
The main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 4: [[Diamond wa Kudakenai]]. He is the illegitimate son of [[Joseph Joestar (old)|]] and [[Higashikata Tomoko]]. His [[stand_(jojo)|Stand]] is [[Crazy Diamond]].

Sports a large [[pompadour]] hairstyle, which he is fiercely protective of. His [[gakuran]] is often seen with [[brooch|brooches]] in the shapes of an [[anchor symbol]], a [[heart]], and a [[peace symbol]].

The "助" (suke) in his given name can also be read "jo". The Kanji in Higashikata (東方) can also be read as "Touhou", meaning "Eastern". So Jousuke's name can mean "Eastern JoJo".

body:
One of many true final bosses of [i][[The Binding of Isaac]][/i], introduced in [i]Afterbirth+[/i]. It initially looks like a giant melting [[skull]] with small [[yellow eyes]].

Aside from some basic [[danmaku]], its main ability is to shapeshift into any boss previously encountered in a given run.

[spoiler]Due to the nature of the boss and its lair, Delirium is widely speculated to repesent Isaac's mind falling apart as he suffocates inside of a toy chest he locked himself into.[/spoiler]

The less violent form of this is [[hands on another's neck]].

Not to be confused with [[choking on object]].

title: afterword
body:
Also known as あとがき (atogaki) in Japanese. A literary device typically found at the end of a work.

The contents of the afterword tend to be from the author's perspective, giving insights on how the ideas for a work were formed, or how the work itself was created. Sometimes, someone other than the author may use the afterword to give commentary on the work's context (e.g. history or culture surrounding the setting).

title: cat_(nyanko_daisensou)
body:
The symbolic circular cat from the mobile game [[Nyanko Daisensou]] ('The Battle Cats' in its English version). It is the first cat unit available when starting the game. Its head is similar to the emoticon (^・∀・^).

Use this tag when:

* The cat is an entity itself, either with tiny legs, or no legs at all;
  or
* The cat's head is a design element of an object worn by another type of cat unit; as in armor, weapons, ornaments, etc. (see: {{cat_valkyrie_(nyanko_daisensou) spear}})

Don't tag when another type of cat has the same head as the basic cat, but is a character on its own (e.g.: [[Sexy Legs Cat (nyanko_daisensou)|]]).

h4. See also

* Battle Cats Wiki: http://battle-cats.wikia.com/wiki/Cat_(Normal_Cat).

body:
Personal mecha of Vita.

A mecha built for aerial dogfighting with incredible mobility. Capable of changing into battle jet mode with its turbo engine and destructive missiles, it will batter all of its enemies in the sky.

title: r.e.d_(smc)
body:
A pilot in Super Mecha Champions. A rebellious girl who grew up in the streets. Without a past, all she has is the future. Both her creed is to crush all injustice. [spoilers]She is Ivan's daughter.[/spoilers]

Her representative mecha is the Firestar.

body: A mainstay mech of the warring era. Doomlight was refits with many unique features in mercenary hand. The three Photon Turrets will make the enemies remember its name.

title: raven_(smc)
body:
Personal mecha of Nighthawk.

A special class hunter mecha. Raven silently take out enemies with its magnetic vibrating bow in unexpected location thanks to its chainhook. Even when being closed in, the mech can still retaliate heavily with its shotgun-like spread shots.

title: uchiha_sasuke
body: A major character in the anime/manga [[naruto|Naruto]]. A teammate of [[uzumaki_naruto|Uzumaki Naruto]] and [[haruno_sakura|Haruno Sakura]]. He became a rogue ninja in order to reap revenge on his older brother [[uchiha_itachi|Itachi]]. He is one of the last remaining members of the Uchiha Clan. Sasuke's voice actor is [[Sugiyama Noriaki]] in Japan, and [[Yuri Lowenthal ]] in the English dub.

title: little_sister_(elona)
body:
A quest character from [[Elona]].  In an "homage" to [[bioshock (series)|BioShock]], Little Sisters are capturable characters found by killing rarely spawning Big Daddy monsters, and can be returned to the Strange Scientist for rare items.  (Specifically, they are captured with "Little Balls", which are special Little Sister-only [[poke_ball|pokeballs]] in an homage to [[Pokemon]].) Because the items you get for the quest include duplicates of otherwise unique objects gained from other quests, they are extremely valuable.  Also in homage to the game, killing and eating a Little Sister grants the player extra Life, Mana, and skill potential, but counts as a "debt" of sisters you need to rescue to gain the rare items.  (This also counts if the little sister dies when you didn't kill her, yourself.)

They have [[black hair]] in a [[bob cut]] or [[hime cut]], depending on the artist, and wear a red [[dress]].

Not to be confused with the similarly-named [[younger_sister_(elona)|Younger Sister]].

title: riko_(smc)
body:
An NPC in Super Mecha Champion.

She is the mascot character of the game, acting as guide for the players, announcer for game news and commentator during battles.

title: skylark_(smc)
body:
Personal mecha of Iori.

It is the symbol of its creator, the Shimuzu family. It is combination of both modern technology and traditional styling. It is known for its mobility, and combining with its left wing that can transform into a bird to absorb enemies energy to repair its own body, Skylark is impossible to win against in a war of attrition.

title: mila_(smc)
body:
Mila is a pilot in Super Mecha Champion.

A young lady who is kind of a spoiled bratty girl. She likes to play various games and after getting bored with other toys, is now enamored with a huge "doll" like Mecha. 

Her representative mecha is the Caramel.

title: caramel_(smc)
body:
The personal mecha of Mila.

A heavy armor mecha that was modified by Mila to fit her taste. Although it has a cutesy design now, underestimating it will subject its enemy to some horrid bombardment. It can change between humanoid mode and tank mode.

title: iori_(smc)
body:
Iori is a pilot in Super Mecha Chamion.

Eldest daughter of the famous Shimizu Family, bound by tradition since birth and yearned for freedom.

Her representative mecha is the Skylark.

title: ivan_(smc)
body:
Ivan is a pilot in Super Mecha Champion.

Ivan was a champ in underground Mecha fighting but has been missing for a long time, and there are rumors of him having a daughter who's been missing for years.

His representative mecha is the Hotsteel.

title: rom_(smc)
body:
A pilot in Super Mecha Champion and one of the two starter characters of the game. A former Ace Mecha Pilot and senior operative whose career came to a screeching halt when he suddenly became wanted 8 years ago. 

His representative mecha is the Arthur.

title: ning_(smc)
body:
A pilot in Super Mecha Champion and one of the two starter characters of the game. An athletic A-student who strives to be No.1 in everything she does, and also a newcomer to the SMC Contest.

Her representative mecha is the Firefox.

title: joanna_(smc)
body:
A pilot in Super Mecha Champion. She used to be a pro rhythmic gymnast before joining an idol group and possesses uncanny agility belying her gentle appearance.

Her representative mecha is the Andromeda.

title: hotsteel_(smc)
body:
Ivan's personal mecha.

A behemoth of rage and fire, hailing from an underground battle world. It takes the battlefield with its aggressive battle style and instill fear into its enemy as it blasts the enemy away with shrapnel and shockwave.

title: firefox_(smc)
body:
Ning's personal mecha.

An old model that was rebuilt into its new glory. It is the symbol of resilience and the never-say-die spirit of its pilot and can fight on par with the new generations of mecha.

title: arthur_(smc)
body:
Rom's personal mecha. 

It has appearance of a knight fitting for its name and is the ace fighter during the Singularity War preceding the series. It utilizes its powerful booster and sword that can create powerful energy wave to control the battle.

title: seele_vollerei_(starchasm_nyx)
body:
A playable battlesuit for [[Seele Vollerei]] in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]], in which her [[Seele (Alter Ego)|alter ego]] fully takes control.

Appearance-wise, she most notably differs from other versions of Seele's dark side in her [[long hair]], [[gauntlets]] and [[vambraces]], and [[medium breasts|more substantial bust]].

body:
[b]Christopher Gonzalez[/b] (b. December 24, 1990)

American competitive fighting game player, known mostly for dominating Ultimate [[Marvel vs. Capcom 3]] tournaments with his team of [[Morrigan Aensland]], [[Doctor Doom]] and [[Vergil (devil may cry)|]]. One time [[Evolution Championship Series|Evolution]] winner, for [i]UMvC3[/i] in 2016.

title: mysterious_scientist_(edf5)
body:
A female scientist featured in [[earth_defence_force_5|Earth Defense Force 5]] in voiceover only. She serves as the player character's contact for the Spritefall line of orbital laser weapons. Notable for her excitable attitude and overwhelming enthusiasm with regard to the weapon and its host satellite which she appears to have been the creator of.

Credited as "mad scientist" in the English localization.

title: dante_(dmc:_devil_may_cry)

Different enough from the [[dante (devil may cry)|Dante]] of the main series that fans call him "Donte" or "Dorkte" due to his overly macho personality unintentionally making him come off as a tryhard.

title: rebellion_(sword)
body: [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante]]'s trademark sword that appears in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] video game series, [[Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne]], and The Animated Series. It's a magical blade given to him as a keepsake from his father, and it serves as both a physical manifestation of his power, and through it's name, meaning "resistance", a symbol of his spirit. The blade's power originally laid dormant, but through contact with Dante's blood, was awakened.

body: Alastor is the first Devil Arm that Dante encounters in the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. It has lightning powers and allows its wielder to make lightning-fast attacks.

title: trish_(devil_may_cry)
body: Character from the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. Trish is a mysterious woman who looks strangely like [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante's]] mother, and who works as his partner.

title: devil_may_cry_1
body: First release of the [[Devil May Cry (series)|Devil May Cry]] franchise launched on October 2001 for the PlayStation 2.

title: force_edge_(dmc)
body: The Force Edge is Dante's original sword from the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series. Though it isn't very powerful at first, certain events later transform the Force Edge into its true form of [[Sparda_(sword)|Sparda]].

title: rin_(kemurikusa)
body:
The main heroine of [i][[Kemurikusa]][/i]. 

She is the main fighter of the sisters and embodies the sense of Sight, which she inherited from [[ryoku (kemurikusa)|Ryoku]]. She is in love with [[wakaba (kemurikusa)|Wakaba]] but doesn't understand her feelings.

title: ryoku_(kemurikusa)
body:
[i][[Kemurikusa]][/i] character.

One of the six main sisters. She embodied the sense of Sight, but [[rin (kemurikusa)|Rin]] inherited her powers after she supposedly died. She is the only one of the sisters who knows how to read & write and keeps a diary, which she is highly protective of.
